lines.text: Lucas, has it ever occurred to you if you just said "mister" to white people and said it like you meant it, you might not be sitting here now?
So I'm to commence now? I can start off by saying "mister" to the folks that drag me outta here and builds a fire under me.
Miss Haversham, I'm not gonna touch yuh now. You're an old lady, but you're in the wrong. You're fightin' the whole county, but you're gonna get tired, and when yuh do get tired, we're gonna go in.

[Unflustered]
I'm goin' for eighty, and I'm not tired yet.
Mr. Hampton is right Miss Eunice, and so are you. They'd pass even Will Legate sooner or later when there's enough of them.

[pause]
But there's one thing that would stop them. Long enough anyhow.

[pause]
And that's somebody without a gun.

[to Lucas in jail]
Well, old man, you've the Devil to pay this time!

[to Lucas]
You don't want justice; you want mercy.

[to Chick]
In matters of life and death a man's vocabulary is almighty small.

[to Uncle John]
You're the lawyer. You're the talker.

[to Chick as he looks out over the crowds in town]
They don't know it out there, but he does. He knows he's finished. He's running through his last few pennies of freedom, and, I reckon, he's gonna spend them the only way he knows... on revenge.
What I want to know is what chick and his buddy would have done if there had been a body in that coffin?
I don't know. I hadn't thought about it.

[Beginning to cook breakfast]
Who can eat more'n two eggs?

[Cooly to Crawford Gowrie as he stands menacingly in the entrance to the jail with a can of gasoline]
Please stay out of my light so I can thread my needle.
